item.title: How to Make the Most of Your Small Screen on Macbook
item.description: IntroductionI have been using a 13" M1 Macbook Air 2020 for a year and a half now, while I’ve been pretty satisfied with the performance, I find myself constantly frustrated by the lack of screen real estate. Sometimes you just need more space to work with. I’ve been trying to make the most of the small 13" screen and I think I’ve found a few ways to do that and make it a bit more bearable.

item.title: How to Toggle Reading Mode in Safari MacOS
item.description: What is reading mode?Reading mode is a feature in Safari that allows you to read articles without any distractions. It removes all the ads, sidebars, and other clutter from the page so you can focus on what’s important: reading. Before enabling reading mode After enabling reading mode How to enable reading mode in Safari? To enable reading mode in Safari, click on the “Reader” button at the top of the browser window.

item.title: Effortless MacOS Desktop Navigation: Boost Your Productivity and Master Your Workflow
item.description: IntroductionAny one who has used a mac knows that the whole MacOS experience revolves around the concept of desktops. Desktops are a way to organize your workflow, and keep your work organized. The problem is that most people don’t use desktops to their full potential. Most of us rely on multiple 3-finger swipes on the trackpad to navigate to the desktop we want. In this blog post, I will show you some shortcuts that you can enable to make this process effortless.

item.title: How to Map Capslock to Escape Key in MacOS Ventura
item.description: IntroductionIn my opinion, Caps Lock is the most useless key on the keyboard I’ve never used it. But the Escape key is the most useful key especially for Vim users. How to Map Caps Lock to Escape Key in MacOS Open System Preferences Go to Keyboard Click on Modifier Keys Select Caps Lock Key and change it to Escape And its done. Now you can use Caps Lock as Escape key.

item.title: How to SSH into MacOS from another device
item.description: SSH (Secure Shell) is a protocol used for secure communication between two devices over a network. It is commonly used to connect to remote servers or to control other devices. item.title: Download YouTube videos from terminal using youtube-dl on MacOS
item.description: youtube-dl is a terminal application which lets you download YouTube videos easily without ads and other bloat, unlike other YouTube video downloaders online. PrerequisitesHomeBrew Install brew using the official HomeBrew Installation instructions Go ahead if already installed Installing youtube-dlTo install youtube-dl using brew, run the following command in the MacOS terminal: brew install youtube-dl Downloading videosTo download YouTube videos using youtube-dl, use the following command: youtube-dl 'youtube-url' Make sure to use quotes around the URL.

item.title: How to Merge PDFs in MacOS
item.description: You can merge PDFs right in the MacOS finder Have all PDFs in a folderMake sure you have all the PDFs you want to merge in the same directory Select the filesYou can select multiple files by CMD + Click Merge files Right Click and hover on Quick Actions Click on Create PDF New merged PDF is now created.
